items.text: The support these kids receive is incredible--it reminds them they're not alone. Military life is tough, and we're grateful for CYP helping our children feel seen and supported through it all.
Month of the Military Child reminds us that purple is more than a color--it's our community.
They are there to support the family from the youngest member to the oldest member.

The sense of community and connection with other military children has been such a help. It showed me what we can overcome together and gave me invaluable leadership skills, helping me mature and feel more connected to my military peers.
Yellow Ribbon workshops connect kids who are facing the same challenges.
This camp brightened our daughter's smile again. The friendships and support she found reminded her she's not alone--something every military kid deserves.
Being a military kid in Iowa can be tough, but this community has been nothing short of amazing. The bonds, support, and love our kids find here remind them they're never alone.
